trans-unit.source: encryptionKeyLength

seg-source.mrk: encryptionKeyLength

target.mrk: encryptionKeyLength

trans-unit.source: Function

seg-source.mrk: Function

target.mrk: Function

trans-unit.source: Specifies the number of bits in the encryption key to be generated when a database is encrypted with the bootPassword=key attribute.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies the number of bits in the encryption key to be generated when a database is encrypted with the bootPassword=key attribute.

target.mrk: Specifies the number of bits in the encryption key to be generated when a database is encrypted with the bootPassword=key attribute.

trans-unit.source: The default encryption key length is 128.

seg-source.mrk: The default encryption key length is 128.

target.mrk: The default encryption key length is 128.

trans-unit.source: You need to specify encryptionKeyLength=length only if all of the following circumstances apply:

seg-source.mrk: You need to specify encryptionKeyLength=length only if all of the following circumstances apply:

target.mrk: You need to specify encryptionKeyLength=length only if all of the following circumstances apply:

trans-unit.source: You are specifying a non-default encryption algorithm (the default is DES).

seg-source.mrk: You are specifying a non-default encryption algorithm (the default is DES).

target.mrk: You are specifying a non-default encryption algorithm (the default is DES).

trans-unit.source: The encryption algorithm you are specifying allows for more than one key length.

seg-source.mrk: The encryption algorithm you are specifying allows for more than one key length.

target.mrk: The encryption algorithm you are specifying allows for more than one key length.

trans-unit.source: You want to use a non-default key length.

seg-source.mrk: You want to use a non-default key length.

target.mrk: You want to use a non-default key length.

trans-unit.source: For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

seg-source.mrk: For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

target.mrk: For information about data encryption, see "Encrypting databases on disk" in the <cite><ph conref="../conrefs.dita#pub/citdevelop"></ph></cite>.

trans-unit.source: Combining with other attributes

seg-source.mrk: Combining with other attributes

target.mrk: Combining with other attributes

trans-unit.source: The encryptionKeyLength=length attribute can be combined with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute (although it is redundant if you use encryptionKey=key).

seg-source.mrk: The encryptionKeyLength=length attribute can be combined with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute (although it is redundant if you use encryptionKey=key).

target.mrk: The encryptionKeyLength=length attribute can be combined with either the bootPassword=key attribute or the encryptionKey=key attribute (although it is redundant if you use encryptionKey=key).

trans-unit.source: The encryptionKeyLength=length attribute may also be combined with the encryptionProvider=providerName and/or encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm attributes.

seg-source.mrk: The encryptionKeyLength=length attribute may also be combined with the encryptionProvider=providerName and/or encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm attributes.

target.mrk: The encryptionKeyLength=length attribute may also be combined with the encryptionProvider=providerName and/or encryptionAlgorithm=algorithm attributes.

trans-unit.source: If you use encryptionKeyLength=length with encryptionKey=key, the key you specify must have the length you specify.

seg-source.mrk: If you use encryptionKeyLength=length with encryptionKey=key, the key you specify must have the length you specify.

target.mrk: If you use encryptionKeyLength=length with encryptionKey=key, the key you specify must have the length you specify.

trans-unit.source: Examples

seg-source.mrk: Examples

target.mrk: Examples

trans-unit.source: -- create a new, encrypted database jdbc:derby:newDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; encryptionKeyLength=192;encryptionAlgorithm=AES/CBC/NoPadding; bootPassword=Thursday -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:myDB;dataEncryption=true; encryptionKeyLength=168;encryptionAlgorithm=DESede/CBC/NoPadding; bootPassword=Wednesday

seg-source.mrk: -- create a new, encrypted database jdbc:derby:newDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; encryptionKeyLength=192;encryptionAlgorithm=AES/CBC/NoPadding; bootPassword=Thursday -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:myDB;dataEncryption=true; encryptionKeyLength=168;encryptionAlgorithm=DESede/CBC/NoPadding; bootPassword=Wednesday

target.mrk: -- create a new, encrypted database jdbc:derby:newDB;create=true;dataEncryption=true; encryptionKeyLength=192;encryptionAlgorithm=AES/CBC/NoPadding; bootPassword=Thursday -- configure an existing unencrypted database for encryption jdbc:derby:myDB;dataEncryption=true; encryptionKeyLength=168;encryptionAlgorithm=DESede/CBC/NoPadding; bootPassword=Wednesday

trans-unit.source: If the specified algorithm does not support the specified encryption key length, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> returns an exception.

seg-source.mrk: If the specified algorithm does not support the specified encryption key length, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> returns an exception.

target.mrk: If the specified algorithm does not support the specified encryption key length, <ph conref="../conrefs.dita#prod/productshortname"></ph> returns an exception.
